7.verse: But I tell you the truth, it is to your advantage that I go away! For if I do not go away, the Helper will not come to you; but if I go, I will send Him to you.

8.verse: “When He comes, He will convict the world about sin, righteousness, and judgment:

9.verse: concerning sin, because they do not believe in Me;

10.verse: concerning righteousness, because I am going to the Father and you will no longer see Me;

11.verse: and concerning judgment, because the ruler of this world has been judged.

12.verse: “I still have much more to tell you, but you cannot handle it just now.

13.verse: But when the Spirit of truth comes, He will guide you into all the truth. He will not speak on His own; but whatever He hears, He will tell you. And He will declare to you the things that are to come.

14.verse: He will glorify Me, because He will take from what is Mine and declare it to you.

15.verse: Everything that the Father has is Mine. For this reason I said the Ruach will take from what is Mine and declare it to you.”

16.verse: Death and Resurrection Foretold - “A little while, and you will no longer see Me; and again in a little while, you will see Me.”

17.verse: Then some of His disciples said to one another, “What does He mean by telling us, ‘A little while, and you will no longer see Me; and again in a little while, you will see Me’? And, ‘Because I am going to the Father’?”

18.verse: They kept on saying, “What’s this He’s saying, ‘A little while’? We don’t know what He’s talking about!”

19.verse: Yeshua knew that they wanted to question Him, so He said to them, “Are you asking each other about this, that I said, ‘A little while, and you will no longer see Me; and again in a little while, you will see Me’?

20.verse: Amen, amen I tell you, you will weep and mourn, but the world will celebrate. You will be filled with sorrow, but your sorrow will turn to joy!

21.verse: “When a woman is in labor, she has pain because her hour has come. But when she gives birth to the child, she no longer remembers the anguish, because of the joy that a human being has been born into the world.

22.verse: So also you have sorrow now; but I will see you again, and your heart will rejoice, and no one will take your joy away from you!

23.verse: “In that day, you will ask Me nothing. Amen, amen I tell you, whatever you ask the Father in My name, He will give you.

24.verse: Up to now, you have not asked for anything in My name. Ask and you will receive, so that your joy may be full.

25.verse: “These things I have spoken to you in metaphors. An hour is coming when I will no longer speak to you in metaphors, but will tell you plainly about the Father.

26.verse: In that day, you will ask in My name—and I’m not telling you that I will ask the Father on your behalf.

27.verse: For the Father Himself loves you, because you have loved Me and have believed that I came forth from God.

28.verse: I came forth from the Father and have come into the world. Again I am leaving the world and going to the Father.”

29.verse: His disciples say, “See, now You’re speaking plainly and not in metaphors.

30.verse: Now we know that You know everything and have no need to be asked anything. By this we believe that You came forth from God.”

31.verse: Yeshua answered them, “Do you now believe?

32.verse: Look, the hour is coming—indeed has come—when you will be scattered, each to his own, and you will abandon Me. Yet I am not alone, because the Father is with Me.

33.verse: These things I have spoken to you, so that in Me you may have shalom. In the world you will have trouble, but take heart! I have overcome the world!”

1.verse: The Son Glorifies the Father - Yeshua spoke these things; then, lifting up His eyes to heaven, He said, “Father, the hour has come. Glorify Your Son, so the Son may glorify You.

2.verse: Even as You gave Him authority over all flesh, so may He give eternal life to all those You have given Him.

3.verse: And this is eternal life, that they may know You, the only true God, and Yeshua the Messiah, the One You sent.

4.verse: I glorified You on earth by finishing the work that You have given Me to do.

5.verse: Now, Father, glorify Me together with Yourself, with the glory which I had with You before the world came to be.”

6.verse: Yeshua Prays for His Disciples - “I have made Your name known to the men of this world that You gave Me. They were Yours; You gave them to Me, and they have kept Your word.

7.verse: Now they have come to know that everything You have given Me is from You.

8.verse: The words, which You gave Me, I have given to them. They received them and truly understood that I came from You, and they believed that You sent Me.

9.verse: I ask on their behalf. Not on behalf of the world do I ask, but on behalf of those You have given Me, for they are Yours.

10.verse: All Mine are Yours, and Yours are Mine; and I have been glorified in them.

11.verse: I am no longer in the world; but they are in the world, and I am coming to You. Holy Father, keep them in Your name that You have given Me, so that they may be one just as We are.

12.verse: While I was with them, I was keeping them in Your name that You have given Me. I guarded them, and not one of them was lost except the son of destruction, so that the Scripture would be fulfilled.

13.verse: “But now I am coming to You. I say these words while I am still in the world, so that they may have My joy made full in themselves.

14.verse: I have given them Your word; and the world hated them, because they are not of the world just as I am not of the world.

15.verse: I am not asking that You take them out of the world, but that You keep them from the evil one.

16.verse: They are not of the world, just as I am not of the world.

17.verse: “Make them holy in the truth. Your word is truth.

18.verse: Just as You sent Me into the world, so I have sent them into the world.

19.verse: And for their sakes I make Myself holy, so that they also may be made holy in truth.”

20.verse: Interceding for All Believers - “I pray not on behalf of these only, but also for those who believe in Me through their message,

21.verse: that they all may be one. Just as You, Father, are in Me and I am in You, so also may they be one in Us, so the world may believe that You sent Me.

22.verse: The glory that You have given to Me I have given to them, that they may be one just as We are one—

23.verse: I in them and You in Me—that they may be perfected in unity, so that the world may know that You sent Me and loved them as You loved Me.

24.verse: “Father, I also want those You have given Me to be with Me where I am, so that they may see My glory—the glory You gave Me, for You loved Me before the foundation of the world.

25.verse: Righteous Father, the world did not know You, but I knew You; and these knew that You sent Me.

26.verse: I made your Name known to them, and will continue to make it known, so that the love with which You loved Me may be in them, and I in them.”

1.verse: Betrayed and Arrested - When Yeshua had said these things, He went out with His disciples across the Kidron Valley, where there was a garden, which He and His disciples entered.

2.verse: Now Judah, who was betraying Him, also knew the place, because Yeshua had often met there with His disciples.

3.verse: So Judah, having taken a band of soldiers and some officers from the ruling kohanim and Pharisees, comes there with lanterns, torches, and weapons.

4.verse: Then Yeshua, knowing all the things coming upon Him, went forward. He said to them, “Who are you looking for?”

5.verse: “Yeshua ha-Natzrati,” they answered Him. Yeshua tells them, “I am.” Now Judah, the one betraying Him, was also standing with them.

6.verse: So when Yeshua said to them, “I am,” they drew back and fell to the ground.

7.verse: So again He asked them, “Who are you looking for?” And they said, “Yeshua ha-Natzrati.”

8.verse: Yeshua answered, “I told you, I am! If you’re looking for Me, let these men go their way.”

9.verse: This was so the word would be fulfilled that He spoke: “I did not lose one of those You have given Me.”

10.verse: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it and struck the servant of the kohen gadol, and cut off his right ear. Now the servant’s name was Malchus.

11.verse: So Yeshua said to Peter, “Put the sword into the sheath! The cup the Father has given Me—shall I never drink it?”

12.verse: Interrogated and Tried - Then the band of soldiers, with the captain and the officers of the Judeans, seized Yeshua and tied Him up.

13.verse: They led Him first to Annas, for he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, the kohen gadol that year.

14.verse: Now Caiaphas was the one who had advised the Judean leaders that it was better for one man to die on behalf of the people.

15.verse: Simon Peter was following Yeshua with another disciple. Now that disciple was known to the kohen gadol, so he went with Yeshua into the court of the kohen gadol.

16.verse: But Peter was left standing outside by the door. So the other disciple, who was known to the kohen gadol, went out and spoke to the doorkeeper and brought Peter in.

17.verse: The maidservant at the door says to Peter, “Aren’t you one of this Man’s disciples too?” He says, “No, I’m not.”

18.verse: The servants and officers were standing around a fire they had made, because it was cold and they were warming themselves. And Peter was also with them, standing and warming himself.

19.verse: The kohen gadol then questioned Yeshua about His disciples and His teaching.

20.verse: “I have spoken openly to the world,” Yeshua answered him. “I always taught in the synagogues and the Temple, where all the Jewish people come together. I spoke nothing in secret.

21.verse: Why question Me? Ask those who have heard what I spoke to them. Look, they know what I said.”

22.verse: When He had said this, one of the officers standing nearby gave Yeshua a slap, saying, “Is that the way you answer the kohen gadol?”

23.verse: Yeshua answered him, “If I have spoken wrongly, give evidence of the wrong; but if rightly, why hit Me?”

24.verse: Then Annas sent Him, still tied up, to Caiaphas, the kohen gadol.

25.verse: Now Simon Peter was standing outside and warming himself. So they said to him, “Aren’t you one of His disciples too?” He denied it and said, “No, I’m not!”

26.verse: One of the servants of the kohen gadol, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, said, “Didn’t I see you in the garden with Him?”

27.verse: Again Peter denied it, and immediately a rooster crowed.

28.verse: Then they led Yeshua from Caiaphas to the Praetorium. It was early. They themselves did not enter the Praetorium, so they would not become unclean but might eat the Passover.

29.verse: Therefore Pilate came out to them and said, “What charge do you bring against this man?”

30.verse: They answered, “If He weren’t an evildoer, we wouldn’t have handed Him over to you.”

31.verse: Then Pilate said to them, “Take Him yourselves, and judge Him by your Torah!” The Judean leaders responded, “We are not authorized to put anyone to death.”

32.verse: This happened so that the word Yeshua spoke would be fulfilled, signifying what kind of death He was about to die.

33.verse: So Pilate went back into the Praetorium, called for Yeshua, and asked Him, “Are you the King of the Jews?”

34.verse: “Are you saying this on your own,” Yeshua answered, “or did others tell you about Me?”

35.verse: Pilate answered, “I’m not a Jew, am I? Your own nation and ruling kohanim handed You over to me! What have You done?”

36.verse: Yeshua answered, “My kingdom is not of this world. If My kingdom were of this world, then My servants would be fighting so that I wouldn’t be handed over to the Judean leaders. But as it is, My kingdom is not from here.”

37.verse: So Pilate said to Him, “Are you a king, then?” Yeshua answered, “You say that I am a king. For this reason I was born, and for this reason I came into the world, so that I might testify to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth hears My voice.”

38.verse: Pilate said to Him, “What is truth?” After he said this, he went out again to the Judean leaders. He said to them, “I find no case against Him.

39.verse: But it’s your custom that I release someone for you at Passover. So do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”

40.verse: They shouted back, “Not this One, but Bar-Abba!” Now Bar-Abba was a revolutionary.

1.verse: Bound and Sentenced - Then Pilate took Yeshua and had Him scourged.

2.verse: The soldiers twisted together a crown of thorns and put it on His head, and dressed Him in a purple robe.

3.verse: They kept coming up to Him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!” and slapping Him over and over.

4.verse: Pilate came out again. He said to them, “Look, I’m bringing Him out to you, to let you know that I find no case against Him.”

5.verse: So Yeshua came out, wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. “Behold, the Man!” Pilate said to them.

6.verse: When the ruling kohanim and officers saw Him, they yelled out, “Execute Him! Execute Him!” Pilate said to them, “Take Him yourselves and execute Him! For I don’t find a case against Him.”

7.verse: The Judean leaders answered him, “We have a law, and according to the Torah He must die, because He claimed to be Ben-Elohim!”

8.verse: When Pilate heard this word, he became even more fearful.

9.verse: He went into the Praetorium again and said to Yeshua, “Where are You from?” But Yeshua gave him no answer.

10.verse: So Pilate said to Him, “You aren’t speaking to me? Don’t You know that I have the authority to release You, and I have the authority to crucify You?”

11.verse: Yeshua answered, “You would have no authority over Me if it hadn’t been given to you from above. For this reason, the one who handed Me over to you has the greater sin.”

12.verse: Pilate tried to let Him go after this; but the Judean leaders cried out, saying, “If you release this Man, you are no friend of Caesar. Everyone who makes himself a king opposes Caesar!”

13.verse: So when Pilate heard these words, he brought Yeshua out and sat down on the judge’s seat at a place called the Stone Pavement (but in Aramaic, Gabbatha).

14.verse: It was the Day of Preparation for Passover, about the sixth hour. And Pilate said to the Judean leaders, “Behold, your king!”

15.verse: They shouted back, “Take Him away! Take Him away! Execute Him!” Pilate said to them, “Should I execute your king?” The ruling kohanim answered, “We have no king but Caesar!”

16.verse: Finally, Pilate handed Yeshua over to be crucified.

17.verse: A Sacrificial Death - Then they took Yeshua. He went out, carrying His own crossbar, to the Place of a Skull, which in Aramaic is called Golgotha.

18.verse: There they crucified Him, and with Him two others, one on each side and Yeshua in between.

19.verse: Pilate also wrote a sign and put it on the execution stake. It was written, “YESHUA HA-NATZRATI, THE KING OF THE JEWS.”

20.verse: Many Judeans read this sign, because the place where Yeshua was executed was near the city; it was written in Hebrew, Latin, and Greek.

21.verse: The ruling kohanim of the Judeans were saying to Pilate, “Don’t write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but that He said, ‘I am King of the Jews.’”

22.verse: “What I have written, I have written,” Pilate answered.

23.verse: So the soldiers, when they executed Yeshua, took His outer garments and made four parts, a part for each soldier. They took His tunic also, but it was seamless, woven top to bottom in one piece.

24.verse: So they said to one another, “Let’s not tear it, but cast lots for it to see whose it will be.” This was so the Scripture would be fulfilled, “They divided My garments among them, and for My clothing they cast lots.” So the soldiers did these things.

25.verse: Standing near the execution stake of Yeshua were His mother, His mother’s sister, Miriam the wife of Clopas, and Miriam from Magdala.

26.verse: Yeshua saw His mother and the disciple whom He loved standing nearby. He tells His mother, “Woman, behold, your son!”

27.verse: Then He tells the disciple, “Behold, your mother!” From that very hour, the disciple took her into his own home.

28.verse: After this, when Yeshua knew that all things were now completed, to fulfill the Scripture He said, “I am thirsty.”

29.verse: A jar full of sour wine was sitting there, so they put a sponge soaked with the sour wine on a hyssop branch and brought it to His mouth.

30.verse: When Yeshua tasted the sour wine, He said, “It is finished!” And He bowed His head and gave up His spirit.

31.verse: It was the Day of Preparation, and the next day was a festival Shabbat. So that the bodies should not remain on the execution stake during Shabbat, the Judean leaders asked Pilate to have the legs broken and to have the bodies taken away.

32.verse: So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and then the other who had been executed with Yeshua.

33.verse: Now when they came to Yeshua and saw that He was already dead, they did not break His legs.

34.verse: But one of the soldiers pierced His side with a spear, and immediately blood and water came out.

35.verse: He who has seen it has testified, and his testimony is true. He knows that he is telling the truth, so that you also may believe.

36.verse: These things happened so that the Scripture would be fulfilled, “Not a bone of His shall be broken.”

37.verse: And again another Scripture says, “They shall look on Him whom they have pierced.”

38.verse: Buried in a Rich Man’s Tomb - After these things, Joseph of Arimathea asked Pilate if he could take Yeshua’s body away. Joseph was a disciple of Yeshua, but secretly for fear of the Judean leaders. Pilate gave permission, so Joseph came and took the body away.

39.verse: Nicodemus, who had first visited Yeshua at night, also came bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, about a hundred pounds.

40.verse: Then they took the body of Yeshua and wrapped it in linen with the spices, as is the Jewish burial custom.

41.verse: Now in the place where He was executed, there was a garden. In the garden was a new tomb where no one had yet been buried.

42.verse: Because it was the Jewish Day of Preparation and the tomb was nearby, they laid Yeshua there.

1.verse: The Lamb of God is Resurrected - Early in the morning on the first day of the week, while it is still dark, Miriam from Magdala comes to the tomb. She sees that the stone had been rolled away from the tomb.

2.verse: So she comes running to Simon Peter and the other disciple, the one Yeshua loved. She tells them, “They’ve taken the Master out of the tomb, and we don’t know where they’ve put Him!”

3.verse: Then Peter and the other disciple set out, going to the tomb.

4.verse: The two were running together, but the other disciple outran Peter and arrived at the tomb first.

5.verse: Leaning in, he sees the linen strips lying there. But he didn’t go in.

6.verse: Then Simon Peter comes following him, and he entered the tomb. He looks upon the linen strips lying there,

7.verse: and the face cloth that had been on His head. It was not lying with the linen strips, but was rolled up in a place by itself.

8.verse: So then the other disciple, who had reached the tomb first, also entered. He saw and believed.

9.verse: For they did not yet understand from Scripture that Yeshua must rise from the dead.

10.verse: So the disciples went back to their own homes.

11.verse: Yeshua Appears to Miriam - But Miriam stood outside the tomb weeping. As she was weeping, she bent down to look into the tomb.

12.verse: She sees two angels in white sitting, one at the head and one at the feet, where Yeshua’s body had been lying.

13.verse: “Woman, why are you crying?” they say to her. She says to them, “Because they took away my Master, and I don’t know where they’ve put Him.”

14.verse: After she said these things, she turned around. And she sees Yeshua standing there. Yet she didn’t know that it was Yeshua.

15.verse: Yeshua says to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Who are you looking for?” Thinking He’s the gardener, she says to Him, “Sir, if You’ve carried Him away, tell me where You’ve put Him, and I will take Him away.”

16.verse: Yeshua says to her, “Miriam!” Turning around, she says to Him in Aramaic, “Rabboni!” (which means Teacher).

17.verse: Yeshua says to her, “Stop clinging to Me, for I have not yet gone up to the Father. Go to My brothers and tell them, ‘I am going up to My Father and your Father, to My God and your God.’”

18.verse: Miriam from Magdala comes, announcing to the disciples, “I’ve seen the Lord,” and what He had said to her.

19.verse: Yeshua Appears to the Disciples - It was evening on that day, the first of the week. When the doors were locked where the disciples were, for fear of the Judean leaders, Yeshua came and stood in their midst! And He said to them, “Shalom aleichem!”

20.verse: After He said this, He showed them His hands and His side. Then the disciples rejoiced when they saw the Lord.

21.verse: Yeshua said to them again, “Shalom aleichem! As the Father has sent Me, I also send you.”

22.verse: And after He said this, He breathed on them. And He said to them, “Receive the Ruach ha-Kodesh!

23.verse: If you forgive anyone’s sins, they are forgiven; but if you hold back, they are held back.”

24.verse: One of the Twelve, Thomas called the Twin, was not with them when Yeshua came.

25.verse: The other disciples were saying to him, “We’ve seen the Lord!” But he replied to them, “Unless I see the nail prints in His hands, and put my finger into the mark of the nails, and put my hand in His side, I will never believe!”

26.verse: Eight days later the disciples were again inside, and Thomas was with them. Yeshua comes, despite the locked doors. He stood in their midst and said, “Shalom aleichem!”

27.verse: Then He said to Thomas, “Put your finger here, and look at My hands. Reach out your hand and put it into My side. Stop doubting and believe!”

28.verse: Thomas answered and said to Him, “My Lord and my God!”

29.verse: Yeshua said to Him, “Because you have seen Me, you have believed? Blessed are the ones who have not seen and yet have believed!”

30.verse: The Reason for Signs and Wonders - Yeshua performed many other signs in the presence of the disciples, which are not written in this book.

31.verse: But these things have been written so that you may believe that Yeshua is Mashiach Ben-Elohim, and that by believing you may have life in His name.

1.verse: Fish for Breakfast with the Risen One - After these things, Yeshua revealed Himself again to the disciples at the Sea of Tiberias. Now here is how He appeared.

2.verse: Simon Peter, Thomas called the Twin, Nathanael of Cana in the Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two of the other disciples were together.

3.verse: Simon Peter said to them, “I’m going fishing.” “We’re coming with you too,” they said. They went out and got into the boat, and that night they caught nothing.

4.verse: At dawn, Yeshua stood on the beach; but the disciples didn’t know that it was Yeshua.

5.verse: So Yeshua said to them, “Boys, you don’t happen to have any fish, do you?” “No,” they answered Him.

6.verse: He said to them, “Throw the net off the right side of the boat, and you’ll find some.” So they threw the net, and they were not able to haul it in because of the great number of fish.

7.verse: Therefore the disciple whom Yeshua loved said to Peter, “It’s the Lord!” When Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he tied his outer garment around himself—for he was stripped down for work—and threw himself into the sea.

8.verse: But the other disciples came in the boat from about two hundred cubits offshore, dragging the net full of fish.

9.verse: So when they got out onto the land, they saw a charcoal fire with fish placed on it, and bread.

10.verse: Yeshua said to them, “Bring some of the fish you’ve just caught.”

11.verse: Simon Peter went aboard and hauled the net to shore. There were 153 fish, many of them big; but the net was not broken.

12.verse: Yeshua said to them, “Come, have breakfast.” None of the disciples dared ask Him, “Who are You?”—knowing it was the Lord.

13.verse: Yeshua comes and takes the bread and gives it to them, and likewise the fish.

14.verse: This was now the third time that Yeshua was revealed to the disciples after He was raised from the dead.

15.verse: Love Restores Peter - When they had finished breakfast, Yeshua said to Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me more than these?” “Yes, Lord,” he said to Him, “You know that I love you.” He said to him, “Feed My lambs!”

16.verse: He said to him again a second time, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me?” “Yes, Lord,” he said, “You know that I love You.” He said to him, “Take care of My sheep!”

17.verse: He said to him a third time, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me?” Peter was grieved because He said to him for a third time, “Do you love Me?” And he said to Him, “Lord, You know everything! You know that I love You!” Yeshua said to him, “Feed My sheep!”

18.verse: “Amen, amen I tell you, when you were younger, you used to dress yourself and walk wherever you wanted; but when you grow old, you will stretch out your hands, and someone else will dress you and carry you where you do not want to go.”

19.verse: Now this He said to indicate by what kind of death Peter was going to glorify God. And after this, Yeshua said to him, “Follow Me!”

20.verse: Peter, turning around, sees the disciple following. This was the one whom Yeshua loved, who also had reclined against Yeshua’s chest at the seder meal and said, “Master, who is the one who is betraying You?”

21.verse: Seeing him, Peter said to Yeshua, “Lord, what about him?”

22.verse: Yeshua said to him, “If I want him to remain until I come, what is that to you? You follow Me!”

23.verse: Therefore this saying went out among the brothers and sisters, that this disciple would not die. Yet Yeshua did not say to him that he would not die, but, “If I want him to remain until I come, what is that to you?”

24.verse: John’s Witness - This is the disciple who is an eyewitness of these things and wrote these things. We know that his testimony is true.

25.verse: There are also many other things that Yeshua did. If all of them were to be written one by one, I suppose that not even the world itself will have room for the books being written!
